name: synapse-graph-task
description: Creates a markdown friendly dependency graph for your Synapse workspace using a mermaid flowchart.
author: Mark Zhukovsky

inputs.name: workspace
inputs.label: Azure Synapse Workspace Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: The name of the Azure Synapse workspace (or Data Factory) to generate a dependency graph for.

inputs.name: synapseDirectory
inputs.label: Synapse Source Directory
inputs.helpMarkDown: The location on the build agent that contains the Azure Synapse workspace (or Data Factory) JSON objects.

inputs.name: artifactStagingDirectory
inputs.label: Graph Artifact Staging Directory
inputs.helpMarkDown: The location on the build agent to save the resulting dependency graph to and publish as artifact.

inputs.name: itemTypes
inputs.label: Item Types to Include in the Graph
inputs.defaultValue: Trigger, Pipeline, LinkedService, Dataset, Dataflow, Notebook, SparkJobDefinition, BigDataPool, IntegrationRuntime, ManagedVirtualNetwork, ManagedPrivateEndpoint
inputs.helpMarkDown:
The comma-separated list of types of Synapse/ADF objects to include in the graph.

Useful to reduce clutter - e.g. you may not care about Datasets, only which Pipelines hit which LinkedServices, or you may only want to see Triggers and Pipelines only, etc.

inputs.name: includePipelineRegex
inputs.label: Pipeline Name Regex for Inclusion
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Add one or more regular expressions and/or explicit pipeline names (one per each line) that will be run on each Synapse/ADF pipeline name to check if it should be included or not.

If the entire name is matched by at least one of these expressions then the pipeline AND ITS DEPENDENCIES will be included in the graph (unless already excluded by the Item Type filter above, or subsequently excluded by any Regex Exclusion rules specified in the next input).

Useful for zeroing in on specific pipelines, e.g. for certain downstream consumers / projects.

inputs.name: requirePathToPipelineRegex
inputs.label: Pipeline Name Regex for Path Checking
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Add one or more regular expressions and/or explicit pipeline names (one per each line) that will be run on each Synapse/ADF pipeline name to check if it should be treated as a 'primary' pipeline.

For the pipelines whose entire name is matched by at least one of these expressions,  all other objects must have a direct path to them.

Useful for de-cluttering, e.g. you may have used a RegEx to include certain pipelines (for example, a utility pipeline), but they may tie to other objects that are still not relevant and you can filter out by ensuring they all have a path to these pipelines of primary interest.

inputs.name: excludeRegex
inputs.label: Object Name Regex for Exclusion
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Add one or more regular expressions and/or explicit object names (one per each line) that will be run on each Synapse/ADF object name to check if it should be excluded or not.

If the entire object name is matched by at least one of these expressions then it will be excluded from the graph (even if matched by one of the Inclusion Regex rules above).

Useful to reduce clutter in the graph, e.g. by excluding common dependencies that all contain a certain identifier in their name, e.g. a utility or the default storage / Key Vault linked service that everything depends on.
